resources.string: How often colours should sync with your wallpaper. You can force an update manually by tapping the widget.

v2.0.1 (February 2016):

New option to tweak automatic color-picking to prefer lighter/darker colors.

Fixed: Muzei wallpaper changes will now automatically force a color update.

Fixed: Touch shortcuts will no longer remove FORM from the Recents overview screen.
 



v2.0 (February 2016):
 Rebuilt from the ground up!


Optimised widget rendering code.


Much more flexible colour options:
 - You can now pick any ARGB colour, or pick one of the presets.
 - Separate colour controls for outlines and complications.
 - Each colour can now be 'locked' individually.
 --- Locked colours will stay the same no matter what wallpaper you use.
 --- Unlocked colours will be replaced by colours picked from your wallpaper.


Flexible new formatting options for the clock and any complications.


New option to change widget layout depending on device rotation


New option to change the frequency of colour-syncing with your wallpaper. Choose a lower frequency to reduce system resource usage.
 - You can always tap on the widget to force a re-sync.


You can now choose more than one app shortcut - if more than one is selected then tapping the widget will show you a launcher list to choose from, otherwise it will open the chosen app immediately.

Added a very basic Daydream. For now this is essentially an easter egg but will be improved on in future updates.

v2.0.d

Some users have had problems with the touch shortcut settings, so I have reimplemented that dialog. I was not able to replicate the error so this is mostly guesswork - if you have had issues before please let me know if this has fixed it for you!

- The shortcut menu is now sorted properly and shows package names to help you figure out which app called e.g. 'Clock' you actually want to use.

Added a very basic Daydream. It currently uses the same settings as the widget and can be a little wonky - optimization and customization will be implemented when possible.

Minor dialog animation tweaks.
 



v2.0.c

You can now choose the opacity of custom colours.


More formatting options:

- Explicitly choose 12- or 24-hour formatting to override your system settings.

- Removed restrictions on custom date formatting.

- Toggle for upper or lowercase in complication text.

- Optional zero-padding.

- Formatting options have moved to their own tab.


Unlocked colour buttons now show a coloured icon to show which colour they have pulled from your wallpaper.


Fixed: weird looking complication text shadow on some devices

 



v2.0.b (16 November 2015)

Colour patches now fade out when they are not in effect. Still not sure this is completely intuitive but it's better than before.


Fixed: The midnight hour now correctly shows as '12:xx' in 12-hour format.


Fixed: Colour picker no longer gets weird when you click on an empty space. 


Fixed: Bug that could cause 2 options to be selected in 'Colour update frequency' dialog.

 



v2.0.a (14 November 2015)
 Rebuilt from the ground up!


Optimised widget rendering code.


New option to change widget layout depending on device rotation.


Much more flexible colour options:

- You can now make any RGB colour, or pick one of the presets.

- Separate colour controls for outlines and complications.

- Each colour can be 'locked' individually:

--- Locked colours will stay the same no matter what wallpaper you use.

--- Unlocked colours will be replaced by colours picked from your wallpaper.


New date formatting options.


New option to change the frequency of colour-syncing with your wallpaper. Choose a lower frequency to reduce system resource usage. You can always touch the widget to force a colour update.


You can now choose more than one app to open when you touch the widget. Tapping the widget will force a colour update, regardless of other settings.
Colour selection is now much more flexible and works a little differently.
